articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Famous Work Brought out in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Famous Work Brought out in Russia 
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable" was brought out in booklet by the Primorskoye Morskoye Parakhodstvo Publishing House in Russia.
 The work, published on March 1, Juche 82 (1993), discloses the reactionary and false nature of the sophistry of the imperialists and renegades of socialism slandering socialism as "totalitarian", "barracks-like" and "administrative and commanding".    
 It clarifies principled issues arising in defending and accomplishing the cause of socialism such as the issue of making socialism faith and morality and giving full play to its advantages.

articles.title: DPRK's Statement Supported
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies 
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassies in Damascus, New Delhi, Jakarta, Conakry and Teheran received floral baskets from various personages and organs on the occasion of leader Kim Jong Il's birthday.
 They were sent by the deputy general secretary of the Baath Arab Socialist Party, the president of the People's Assembly and the foreign minister of Syria, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party (Marxist) of India and the joint secretary of the All-India Agricultural Workers' Union, the chairman of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle and his wife, the general secretary of the Party for Unity and Progress and the minister of Information of Guinea, and the Ministry of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics, the Proletarian and Islamic Revolutionary Wounded Organization and the Workers' House of Iran.    
 Meanwhile, the DPRK embassies in New Delhi and Conakry also received floral baskets from the director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and the director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.

articles.title: Russian Diplomats Help Korean Farmers
Message of Sympathy to Iranian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Iranian President 
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of sympathy to Iranian President Seyed Mohammad Khatami for the heavy losses in human lives and materials caused by an earthquake that hit Kerman Province, Iran.
 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the victims and bereaved families and hoped that the Iranian government would recover from the consequences of the disaster and bring the living of the people in the afflicted areas back to normal conditions at an early date.

Message of Sympathy to Bangladeshi Prime Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Bangladeshi Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of sympathy to Bangladeshi Prime Minister Khaleda Zia.
 Upon the sad news that there were heavy losses of human lives caused by the wrecking accident of a passenger ship in Bangladesh, the message expressed sincere sympathy and consolation to the prime minister and, through him, to the victims and bereaved families.

articles.title: Pyongyang Architectural Decoration Factory
Congratulatory Message to Ukrainian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Ukrainian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Boris Tarasyuk upon his appointment as Ukrainian foreign minister.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably in the future, too, the message wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to His Uzbekistani Counterpart
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to His Uzbekistani Counterpart
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to E. M. Ganiev upon his appointment as deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Uzbekistan.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow strong in the interests of their peoples and wished him success in his new job.
